intro: Gunnarella gracilis, commonly known as the slender gunnaria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and along streambanks. Gunnarella gracilis is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often found in disturbed or open habitats.
